website_summaries.verdict: Big generator will provide plenty of power for whatever appliances you want to run during a camping trip.
pros: Offers maximum 7,500W of power, so you can run a lot of appliances
Simple one-touch electric start or remote key fob
Considering the size, it's not as noisy as similar models
Includes 2 wheels to help you move it

customer_reviews.title: Produces plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: Pros: came via drop shipping as scheduled without damage. Easy to unbox and assemble. Remote start works great and is very convenient. Produces plenty of power and doesn’t bog down with high surge loads. Gas shutoff is easy to access. Included instructions were clear on how to convert the generator to a floating neutral (most homes with a transfer switch). Cons: Heavy (but not bad to move with the wheels). Loud (but tolerable compared to other open frame generators in this range) Bottom line- Affordable and powerful this is the best of its class. Consumer reports rates it well and I agree with them.
customer_reviews.author: RachNDave

customer_reviews.title: Really good generator for a mid sized home
customer_reviews.text: Got this in the aftermath of hurricane Maria. This is a really good generator and I am pleased with the purchase. This is our second unit and we use it at night. It has enough power for a 18,000 watt AC, freezer, fridge, lights, two fans and lasts 9-10 hours on a full gas tank. The remote control is extremely convenient and useful for us aging folks. The noise level is not bad - much better than our 5500 CAT unit. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A simple fix but no customer support
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Generator nearly 3 weeks ago and unpackaging, setup and start worked well. It had a oil leak from the valve cover gasket. Upon checking the gasket, found it to be damaged on installation from the factory. I contacted Westinghouse and they said no problem, they would send me a new gasket. Have contacted them numerous times and every time they are too busy with various excuses. This would require a $2 part and 2 minute installation and yet they do not have time for their customers. Worst Customer Service I have ever encountered and will never purchase anything from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Think twice before purchasing one of these!
customer_reviews.text: Had the gen for a month and it died! Couldn’t get a hold of tech support! Then I get an email asking for proof of purchase, serial number and when it ran last. The questions were fine but the email stated after I answered them a tech would help me troubleshoot the problem? To see if the problem was operator error I took the gen to a mechanic and paid for a diagnosis. The result was either a bad solenoid or the in the guts of the housing it was attached to. Positively a warranty issue. I would definitely not get a gen from Westinghouse in the future! If I were you I would not get one!
customer_reviews.author: DR Novielli

customer_reviews.title: MOTOR PROBLEMS
customer_reviews.text: I run the generator first with out load for about 20 min without problems, stored for a two months but runing it every 3 weeks, the gas tank has the estabilizer, last week i run it with load for 3 hours and it runs ok, before turnin it off I leave it run without load for 10 minutes and then shut off the gas valve and wait until the generator turn off by itself. I try yesterday to run it again and the motor was backfiring, check the gas, filter , oil and at last I removed the valve cover and noticed the intake valve is struck.
customer_reviews.author: Blas Daboin

customer_reviews.title: Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Generator was delivered with a broken funnel, and NO oil! I contacted Westinghouse and they said that was "unfortunate". What is unfortunate is that i am going over onto Facebook and Twitter to let everyone know how poor their service is and how little they care about a customer who has just spent $1,000.
customer_reviews.author: Garry Craske

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy!
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as described. It says it runs up to 7500 but it's more like 5000. Dont buy it will be a mistake. I also tried to contact customer service and they had no idea about the generator I believe It is a company that is just a answering service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Electric start up is great! Runs long time
customer_reviews.text: After losing power for seven days following a storm, I knew it was time to get a portable generator. I did a lot of research and the Westinghouse WGen7500 generator had the best reviews. The Generac portable brand had oil leakage issues (and is better if you want a full house permanent generator). For a portable generator, Westinghouse is great! You have to get a transfer switch installed by an electrician. Then plug in the portable generator to the outlet and amazing! It is very easy to start thanks to the electric start button. It holds a lot of gasoline and has to be filled up twice per day depending on how much load you put on it.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Electric start does not work, battery bad and so was the replacement Westinghouse sent me
customer_reviews.text: The electric start will not work on the generator I bought. I took the battery to an auto parts place to have it checked as Westinghouse suggested. Battery is bad. Westinghouse sent me a replacement. It was bad, also. I bought a battery myself and the electric start still does not work. I have emailed Westinghouse twice asking what to try next. Been almost two weeks and no response. do not buy this generator.
customer_reviews.author: Scribbles

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered with battery damaged which failed within 5 months. This makes the rest of the assembly suspect for safety reasons. Questionable parts and assembly. Westinghouse unsympathetic. After reading other reviews, afraid to use.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh T.

customer_reviews.title: Are you kidding me?
customer_reviews.text: Received generator but wouldn’t work. Two short wires were zip tied together and not even connected. One wire would make more sense. When I contacted the company they said they’d have a technician call me back. It’s been three days! Thankfully the hurricane missed us-but another will be coming. What a piece of garbage and a piece of garbage company!
customer_reviews.author: KJG

customer_reviews.title: Leaks from gas gauge - Westinghouse claims this is ok
customer_reviews.text: One feature they forget to mention - it leaks gas from the fuel gauge. Talked to customer service and they claim this is normal since the gas tank isn't waterproof? Not only does it leak gas when you move it, but the gas pours over the exhaust end which could catch fire. This hasn't been a feature I've seen with any other generator.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Not off to a good start
customer_reviews.text: I received the generator quickly, assembled it per the instructions, attached my propane tank and......nothing. The generator won’t start. I called Westinghouse customer support. The support technician walked me through everything and told me to try starting the generator. The generator won’t start. The technician then told me to go purchase gasoline and try starting the generator with gasoline. I told the technician the reason I bought this generator is because I don’t want to mess with gasoline. The technician told me if I don’t want to mess with gasoline then I should contact Amazon and return the generator. Bottom line, new generator doesn’t work and customer support isn’t helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't start easily, Electric start broke when needed most.
customer_reviews.text: Product was bought for the obvious reasons. After owning for 2+ years and doing regular monthly runs to keep it properly lubed when I finally needed it the electric start wouldn't work... It always took a long time to start evsuring that I always had good gas and running the little gas I added to it was gone. Disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: JTizzz

customer_reviews.title: Wires not connected - would not start right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The red wires were not connect so it would not start right out of the box. Paid someone to figure that out so we could get it started. Still have a black wire that is frayed at the another connection and not under the wire cover. It is sad when a brand new $$$ generator will not start. Poor workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: DIRECT SHORT TO THE FRAME.  SPARKS EVERYWEAR WITH 5 GALLONS OF GAS IN THE TANK.  DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk ! Be warned, it had a direct electric short to the frame. Sparks everywhere. We could have been killed ! ZERO STARS WAS NOT AN OPTION.
customer_reviews.author: Bucky

customer_reviews.title: Horror story, leaky, wouldn’t work and Westinghouse has no answers
customer_reviews.text: Unit arrived with oil that had leaked out of the unit and was completely nonfunctional. Worked with Westinghouse repeatedly without a resolution. They report replacement parts are back ordered and suggest I purchase upgraded parts like spark plugs fillers etc on my own dime.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Wish I didn’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Have a propane smell customer service said I have to turn gas off after every time I use it. What’s the remote start for if you have to be there to turn the gas off. Don’t buy if your off the grid unless you want to go to generator any time to start and shut off
customer_reviews.author: Joe of the jungle

customer_reviews.title: exceeds expectations, features and Engineering , price
customer_reviews.text: Short review, I just received this generator from Amazon freight. Freight came in fine , the box was in perfect shape, no damages. So far the generator exceeds my expectations. I will provide a follow up at a later date when I have the ability to run it through some more testing. This is my third generator , and the Westinghouse product appears to be more then just a shinny frame. The technology is great, started up on both propane and gas immediately. The remote start Key Fob worked every click. did I mention the auto choke this thing has "Auto Choke"! never have to touch the choke.
customer_reviews.author: FLPaintman

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered new generator wont start no helo with westinghouse customer service
customer_reviews.author: mike l

customer_reviews.title: Not to be used in Fowl weather???
customer_reviews.text: It seems strange to me that when a person buys a generator to power their home due to a power outage, usually caused by fowl weather, that upon reading the instructions, you find out the thing can't be exposed to rain, snow, or Ice as it may short out the generator. There was nothing in the description online that said anything about not being able to use it in bad weather. It seems like a great generator, but now I have to build it a little house to keep it dry, or is there something I can purchase to protect it to make that a non issue?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not function.
customer_reviews.text: This generator ran for 2 minutes and stopped - could not get it to restart - tried all fuel methods. Had to research a Westinghouse repair place - and manually get it there. Dropped it off several weeks ago and have not heard a word. So much for having a generator for the winter in case we loose power. Cannot return on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: ROXANNE CHURCHILL

customer_reviews.title: Want to run a refrigerator? BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: (This review is for the WGen7500) This is a really nice piece of equipment. Excellent documentation, intuitive, runs great. IMPORTANT NOTE: I tried to power my refrigerator using an extension cord plugged into the 120v outlet on this generator, and the GFCI outlet on the generator kept tripping every 15 minutes or so. I did some research, and evidently generators over 5KW require GFCI outlets. If you want to power your refrigerator from the 120v outlets on a generator, then buy one that's smaller than 5KW (and make sure it doesn't have GFCI outlets.)
customer_reviews.author: Clifton Nolunvoid

customer_reviews.title: Right out of the box, won’t start.
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this product only two stars mainly because when I received it, I went through the instructions to start it and it won’t start??? Has oil and gas Battery is charged Fuel line is on It turns over but nothing I also called the number on the generator and was told I’d hear back within 24-32 hours. Wow, really that’s what you call “Lifetime Technical Support”. Let’s see what happens, then I’ll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: L.St.George

customer_reviews.title: Innovative design, cheap Chinese construction.
customer_reviews.text: A connection came loose while it running inside the end cap on the generator housing. Fried the AVR and MM display. Unit became useless after only a few weeks of use. Luckily amazon customer service replaced it and we could keep working. Not nearly as robust or reliable as the Kohler/Miller welder generator we have, but it's able to run our big TIG on mobile applications. The keyless feature is nice because you can park it far away and still save fuel between setups.
customer_reviews.author: Alec J. Seastrand

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Nice generator purchased for emergencies but arrived damaged. The freight company delivered within the timeframe requested. Cut the undamaged box away and found the rollbar was bent fairly severely as indicated in photos.
customer_reviews.author: the band Walenia

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy Set Up
customer_reviews.text: Generator arrived today on time and not damaged. Removing it from the carton, attaching the wheels and feet was a snap. Have not run full power as yet, but will soon. One word of caution, the qt. of oil supplied, did not quite show full on the stick. And, as with the NEW engine may use a little oil at first, I would suggest having a little extra on hand. 10W-30 for small engines 4 stroke. This really looks like a great generator for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Candoitoo

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy it. I have just one month use it and All ready doesn’t work the automátic start and is imposible start ir manually . This generator sucks
customer_reviews.author: Santiago V.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: One of my best purchase of the yr. Our power goes out on the regular. In one yr we had to use the generator quite a bit from 6 to 12 hr power outage to 3 day power outage from hurricane harvey. It runs full load six hrs so it runs refrigerator, several lights, 2 5k btu window units fans and coffee pot with no problems for six hrs oh and one small deep freeze. It so easy to use I work away from home so my wife is the using it most and she loves. Only time will tell if its truly a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: duckco

customer_reviews.title: Short lived protection
customer_reviews.text: The battery is short lived and warranted for 3 months only. The battery is prone to frailer per the customer service. This was their very first issue when I reached customer service. After 9 months of ownership. I used it for three months for my home back-up. Then set dormant for 6 months. Then battery is dead. Electric start not work, pull start did work one time. Westinghouse guarantee is useless even at a Westinghouse recommended facility. That facility will not honor Westinghouse commitments. and statements.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J. Sachs

customer_reviews.title: WGEN9500DF - Fantastic Generator
customer_reviews.text: First off, the shipping was very fast and delivery went smooth. The box arrived in excellent condition. No damage at all. Assembly couldn't have been any easier. Install the two feet, attach the wheels, connect the battery wires, and add oil. I used it with propane. The generator fired up right away. I ran it for a few hours to ensure all was good. The next day I ran it for another hour or so with a few things plugged into it. Eventually I will be powering my entire house with this unit if the power goes out. Overall, I am very pleased with the generator so far. If I encounter any issues I will report back.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L

customer_reviews.title: Easy instructions, no damages upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were clear except for one thing - the battery isn't connected to the generator upon arrival. The start FOB therefore didn't work, and neither did the push button start. I read through the instructions for starting it, but this little detail was missing. It took a guess on my part, and after that, the battery was fine. It was slow to fire up on propane, took 15 or so pulls on the pull-start cord. I'm not sure why, but after that it started and ran fine. I haven't tested it with any challenging loads yet, so that is why I gave it 3 stars. After using it in a power outage situation, I'll post an update.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Questionable reliability, gut the Honda instead...
customer_reviews.text: This generator is very heavy, very loud, and after 2 months of owning it, (18 hours of run time), will not produce 240v power. Contacted Westinghouse and they want me to bring it in for servicing which they say may take 2-4 weeks. Seems a bit disappointing to me. To spend the money on a new item and have it quit working that quickly. I would suggest spending the extra to get the Honda.
customer_reviews.author: Doe a Deer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised but loud.
customer_reviews.text: First power outage, I fired it up. Unbeknownst to me, my wife had the oven on when the power went out. She didn't turn it off. The generator went on, engaged, let out a big groan as the governor kicked in and then happily went about its business running fridge, freezer, OVEN, multiple UPSs charging etc. That was on Propane. It claims more power when on gasoline. It is portable but heavy. Plastic wheels are OK but feel like I have to be super careful not to break them going over bumps. The neighborhood was very quiet so it could be heard from a distance. I would like an option of a quieter muffler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality build - Easy assambly
customer_reviews.text: The Westinghouse WGen12000DF arrived on a small pallet and was simple to open and complete the minor assembly steps. Removing from the pallet required a little care but I was able to do it with no help by tipping it back until the wheels touched and the pallet was free to be removed. Startup was simple...added the oil, connected the battery, connected the LP, set the run switches, pushed the button. The generator delayed for a few seconds before the starter engaged but the engine started quickly and ran smoothly. Freq and volts were spot on, as advertised. Will use this for whole-house power backup, when necessary, but don't have real use information to share yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Risko

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: This generator should not be marketed as a whole house back up. The electric comes out so dirty it will damage everything in your house. After the test run i set up the return right away. Very disappointed the find the total harmonic distortion is about 25... 25 is so high it will damage anything it is powering. Also very loud and only runs at one speed. Does not have auto idle like advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P.

customer_reviews.title: what you need to connect this generator to home's 3/4" propane gas pipe
customer_reviews.text: It needs a special double flared connector to complete the gas line connection. If your hardware store supplied flex pipe is 5/8" OD as is mine, you'll need to order online a female 1/2" flare x male 5/8" flare connector. Cost is ~ $ 20 with shipping, tax. None of the local hardware & big hardware stores had this connector. Save your gas & time by ordering online. Westinghouse support is very poor. Haven't powered on generator yet - waiting for "my special" brass connector. Ignore ratings, except tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Five Star, Excellent Unit
customer_reviews.text: Received Generator today, extremely easy to assemble wheels and stands. Hooked up battery, propane tank, pushed start on the wireless remote and unit fired right up. currently have it hooked up to Reliance Controls WKPBN30 Portable Generator Through-the-Wall Kit Pwr Transfer. Haven't tried gas yet, rather use propane. So far very satisfied with this purchase. 8/9/2018. Had a 2 hour power failure today, generator worked like a charm. Was able to power most of my home. Electrician had just installed a generator interlock kit yesterday. Timing couldn't Be any better.
customer_reviews.author: Harveyvicky2006

customer_reviews.title: 50 Amp receptacle is nearly useless
customer_reviews.text: After breaking in the generator motor and getting ready to test it with powering the house, I came to realize the 50 Amp receptacle is positioned such that it cannot receive a 90 degree 14-50P plug (blocked by the wheel). Finding a 14-50P cable without a 90 degree plug is not easy. Now I have a 25' 50 Amp cable that is useless to me (and cannot be returned) and have to spend another $200 to get a cable that will work. If you want to use the 50 Amp receptacle be sure to get a straight plug, not angled.
customer_reviews.author: SDT

customer_reviews.title: Great value and customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I had a 50AMP transfer switch installed at my home in preparation for this generator. Once I got it and hooked it up to my home, it powered everything just fine, including two refrigerators and a central a/c. It offers great peace of mind in case I lose power in a storm. I've tried running it on propane, but it won't stay on. I gave Westinghouse a call and a regulator replacement is on the way. Hopefully that's all it is. It runs fine on gas, but love the flexibility to run on LPG as well in case gas become scarce as it always does post storm.
customer_reviews.author: Julio

customer_reviews.title: Well made; if it were less noisy I would give five stars
customer_reviews.text: I have set this up and given it a test run. Assembly was very easy, and the whole thing was well packaged and seems very high quality. At first I could not figure out how to move it since I didn't see the moveable bar in front, so it was hard to maneuver, but once I found the bar it was very easy. Starts great; love the automatic start and even the remote start. If it were less noisy (though it is probably less noisy than many competitors), I would give it five stars. Will update after heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Saint John

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a solid/quality generator - WGen9500DF
customer_reviews.text: Generator was delivered undamaged with everything in the box as described (oil, funnel, propane line, wheel kit, etc.). Upon unpacking, the immediate impression I get is that the generator is solidly built. I went ahead and filled it with synthetic oil as noted in the operator's manual. The generator was already paired to the remote start and initial operation was immediate without any hiccups. It is a bit noisy (similar to my lawnmover) but I wouldn't expect anything less from a serious generator. Haven't loaded it up yet but will be back to update my review accordingly. Love all of the features and everything is very straightforward. So far I think I made a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Vadim Kovynev

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of the fgrounded neutral!
customer_reviews.text: This generator works great...ONCE I WIRED IT CORRECTLY. If you are going to hook this up to your house power panel you have to disconnect the neutral ground otherwise the breaker will continuously trip. I wasted about 5 hours trying to troubleshoot this until I found a Westinghouse Bulletin online showing how to change it from a bonded ground to a floating ground. WHY DIDNT THEY PUT THIS BULLETIN IN THE INSTRUCTIONS!!!!???? If you are going to use this just to plug into appliances you are fine, but be aware of the neutral ground issue if you are hooking up to your house panel.
customer_reviews.author: Boatdog

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this generator because it was a push start and/or remote start so that my wife would be able to start without the physical effort of pulling the cord to start. Also, the fuel tank is relatively small but it lasts ALOT longer than other generators that are the same or LOWER wattage which I thought was awesome. There are many things that I would say that makes this the best choice for my needs. The only downside is the noise level of it. If you get this and live in a residential area you will either need to share power your neighbors (lol) or put some type of cover over to reduce the noise level. Great product, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Greg B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Generator. My #1 purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: We lost power for three days. This ran constantly except for two hours a day to let it cool before fueling in the morning and topping off at night. It is not quiet but it isn’t super loud either. It was outside our bedroom window and we were able to sleep. This starts every time. Love the dual fuel feature. Pick up a funnel. Mine arrived damaged but customer service was awesome and Westinghouse paid to have it fixed right away. They were friendly and helpful and responsive. It is very easy to use! Buy this generator! You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Norris

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable and did not uphold warranty
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to use along with two Generac generators that still work great but the Westinghouse broke within 6 months. We took to a shop that they directed us to for warranty work. They took one month to then decide that the issue was because they think it was a maintenance issue. Funny how there's no issue with the other two that all have the same regular maintenance on them. will never buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Harriet Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Product Arrived Broken
customer_reviews.text: The bottom metal piece was cracked when it arrived. The generator looks like it was dropped and is now not able to be used at all.
customer_reviews.author: Petar

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Loud
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot of generator for the money, but I found it to be rather loud. Standing next to it, my meter read nearly 90db. At 20 feet it dropped into the low 80s. I had to stand nearly 50 ft away to get into the low 70s on the meter I was using. This was with no load. This was my experience anyway. I’m sure results may very. Overall, it’s a lot of bang for the buck, but I did find it to be rather noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Ridge Runner

customer_reviews.title: This is the generator to buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I have installed many generators for people that’s part of my work. This Westinghouse 9500/12,500 unit is a piece... At a bargain price. I finally got one for myself and ran it today and it worked perfectly. Love the remote feature which will save me going back out into inclement weather down the road. This thing makes a lot of power, the noise is a moderate level but not deafening.It is very important for me that a portable generator has a 50 amp output outlet on it so that I can effectively back up to the entire home with it. Westinghouse has a real winner with this product.
customer_reviews.author: SUPER SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: After reading so many positive reviews we bought this generator to be a backup for a Honda eu7000. Unboxed it. Everything looked fine. Didn’t have any gas on hand to I hooked up the bbq propane tank after it was assembled and oil put in. Started right up. Great. Not so fast. Once I put gas in and switched it to run on gas, opened the fuel valve and... nothing. Would not turn over. Checked all the fuel lines. Was getting fuel even drained the carburetor there was fuel in there. Even changed the spark plug. Nothing. Tried calling Westinghouse, apparently they don’t work on weekends. What a hunk of junk and a waste of time. Buy a generac.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great generator, started on 2nd pull.
customer_reviews.text: Great little generator, very easy to move around considering how powerful it is. Was damaged during shipping but reached out to Westinghouse support via email and they are sending me a replacement Alternator end cap so apart from that cosmetically it seem ok. Filled the engine with the included oil, added some gas and it started on the 2nd pull. Ran a few appliances and seemed fine so feeling confident for Hurricane season :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ned

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this generator as an emergency power source for my house. I'll be connecting it through a GenerLink transfer switch that I'm having attached to my electric meter. I haven't powered this generator up yet, but I did unpackage it tonight and assembled what little needed assembly (wheels & feet). That couldn't have been easier. The owners manual is easy to understand and everything on the generator itself is clearly labeled. I'll update this review after I get everything set up and do a test run.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Murri

customer_reviews.title: Oil Leak
customer_reviews.text: There is a very minor oil leak. I called about the problem but never heard back from tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent generator WGen9500DF
customer_reviews.text: Westinghouse will make you love this unit right out of the box. They include the battery, remote control start, oil, funnel, propane regulator, and even a tool kit to help you install legs/wheels and maintain plugs when required. It was simple to set up, add fuel, and test run the generator to be sure we are ready for hurricane season. A little louder than expected. They state 74 dBA, but I tested it at 79 dBA AT 20 FEET AWAY. Better than the unit I am replacing but wouldn't want it next to my RV. Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: S. Largent

customer_reviews.title: does not work in cold weather
customer_reviews.text: They could at least said so before sending me on wild goose chase to repair shop, twice, or put it in the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good design and well built.
customer_reviews.text: Easily assembled and started right up on propane. The problem was there was no electrical output. Read manual twice. Pushed reset button and checked all breakers to no avail. Called customer service and was told that all techs were busy and that someone would get back within 24 hrs. Two days later I got an email with a copy of page in manual and advice on how to connect battery to get engine started. I had clearly said that generator ran but no output. I am upset with Westinghouse service and have scheduled a return through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Stretton

customer_reviews.title: Westinghouse WGen9500DF Dual Fuel Portable Generator-9500
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Westinghouse WGen9500DF Dual Fuel Portable Generator-9500 to power our camper when no electricity is available, and for emergency power outages. I have not had a chance to fully utilize this generator to its capacity, but after initial testing I am very impressed. It started up quickly, and runs like a dream. I love the automatic start! As with all generators, this one does produce a good bit of noise, but that is to be expected. The unit is heavy, and a 2-man job to lift. Maneuvering on the ground is easily done by one. So far, I would recommend it to anyone needing a powerful generator.
customer_reviews.author: April Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Very Compact for such a high capacity genrator
customer_reviews.text: This is the 1st impression upon unboxing the genrator I just received today. I was quite surprised and impressed when I saw how compacted the box arrived. For a 9500watts running and 12k peak, its size a about a small cooler. It's heavy. But another surprise when I lift to move it within the garage, the design is excellent to disper the weight to the back. Despite 200 lbs plus weight, lifting it was like child play. I asked my wife (120 lbs petite lady) to lift it and she has no problem moving it by herself. When I finish adding oil and gas, I will come back for an update on how it runs.
customer_reviews.author: Joy N

customer_reviews.title: So far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: This generator was purchased to provide emergency power through a transfer switch for all house, garage, well pump system, and ac system. After following all set up instructions for the Gen ...fuel, oil, etc, it started immediately and runs smoothly. Just tested it today (9/16/20)...with virtually all electric going at once and there was no issues anywhere. :-) :-) This is prelimanary assessment so will be following up as appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Fun

customer_reviews.title: One of the best generators on the market runs clean.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before purchasing this Westinghouse generator that runs on propane also that would be available during power outage of hurricane when gasoline cannot be pumped. Remote starting is a nice touch Westinghouse now assures me that instructions now include directions for connecting cable halves for battery on unit. Noise is as expected operations are clean and odorless running strongly suggest purchasing 40 amp extension cord andElectrical connection to run from house to breaker box. I can run my two mini splits which cools my entire house my refrigerator and living room with television VCR cable box etc. I know my relatives will be coming to my house during hurricane.
customer_reviews.author: GLENN CANON

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size.
customer_reviews.text: Great generator. Very well built. Wheels have steel ballbearing inserts. Reasonable noise level. Most transfer switches are 30 amp. I’m an electrician so let me explain. Circuit breakers trip at 80% capacity. At 220 volts times 24 amps (80% of that 30 amps) a generator has 5280 useable watts. That makes this 5300 watt generator the perfect size. I almost can’t wait for a power outage to use this. Good packaging. Arrived with no damage. Overall a very nice dependable generator.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Prater

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Powerful, Quiet and Less Expensive than Comparable Units
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research before buying the WGen9500, and glad I did. It's smaller than my neighbor's similarly rated generator, much quieter and more fuel efficient. Unpacking, installing the wheels, oil and startup was a breeze. It didn't start right away, but that was my fault. I put about 1/4 gallon of gas in it and it wasn't enough to reach the carburetor on my sloped driveway. I turned it around (carb on the downward slope) and it started on the very first try...and it kept running for 1/2 hour with only that small amount of gas. IMO it's the best high-powered one!
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The wheels didn't fit properly but we removed the washers and the we could make them work. The gas line leaked at the gas valve. So before we could use it we cut and repaired the fuel line. The fuel gauge was broken right out of the box. Over all for the money i was disapointed. I expected better quality. The electric start works, so thats good.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kist

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this!!!! JUNK a
customer_reviews.text: Amazon was great with customer service and all questions and getting in touch with westington house.. but I would not BUY!! Second day using all my plugs stopped working but one gfci.. tried calling and calling westington house no answer.. called amazon and boom Westinghouse answered them.. told me to email all my info.. took 4 days to get a response back from westington house... which they told me to check the voltage regulator which was fine and now 4 days later I’m still waiting for a response from them... JUNK!!! I wouldn’t waste your money!!! Still not working and supposedly under 3 year warranty with Westinghouse but they are not helping me to get it fixed....
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Garbage for me
customer_reviews.text: Garbage for me. Electric start just quit after several month. Now after a year the thing wont even start manually. (yes I use Star Tron Enzyme Fuel Treatment ) (update 25-9-2017 .. one star more cause they replied in here. Will update later if they can solve the problem)
customer_reviews.author: Jorgen

customer_reviews.title: Nice to unbox
customer_reviews.text: just so you know, like the other ratings stated the "bonus" is bogus. If you register your product per first page of the booklet, you cant get the bonus using the bonus URL. That being said I unboxed the unit today as it arrived as stated. It was easy to assemble and install propane line. Starts very easy and is quiet. Only start up tested so I can't give any information on longevity or support. If the bogus "bonus" promise is any indication of service then we who bought this product could be in trouble for warranty service. I puzzles me why Westinghouse would do a bogus bonus to phish for ratings. Oh well!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Economical solution for the next power failure.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as scheduled without damage. Easy to attach wheels and add .9 quart of supplied oil. Attached battery charger after connecting battery. Programmed remote start. Connected propane and she started right up. Quieter than expected. Plenty of power to run water pump, boiler, microwave, coffee pot, and lights with power to spare. This was a very economical solution as opposed to $5000 for a commercially installed alternative. Unit is all steel and well built. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: country gentleman

customer_reviews.title: Damaged in transit had to return.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged. Delivery scheduled for Friday from 9am to 12pm. They showed up Saturday at noon or so.... Box showed some damage, but nothing too concerning (delivered by Amazon not a 3rd party). Upon opening though found it must have taken a pretty big hit to the front. Battery and mount were pushed in and damaged. Whole front panel was pushed in, hour meter was knocked out of panel. Shame, I’ll try again if/when they are back in stock. The generator looked like it would be solid had it not had such a rough ride to my house.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea VanPelt

customer_reviews.title: Warranty Non Existent
customer_reviews.text: We purchased in October of 2017 and it worked well the first few times we used it. Last winter it wouldn't stay on when started. Just spent the last hour and 1/2 trying to get thru to Customer Service only to be told the warranty is no good (3 year warranty) based on info I gave them. We paid $900 for this generator and now have to pay at least $200 for repairs. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: sara kawewehi

customer_reviews.title: Will not last
customer_reviews.text: Nice when it works. Spent more time trying to get it fixed than it spent running. Terrible customer service. Refused to honor their warranty and left me with a 250 lb boat anchor after a little more than a year with only moderate use. I would not buy one of these again. Find something else if you want a reliable product
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Burr

customer_reviews.title: westinghouse generator
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up. hooked it to propane after i filled with oil. great oil funnel they give.push the start button and it started right up.let it run for about and hour and then plug in some tools and they ran and the generator never raised the motor.shipping was not to good,it had several dents,but that was not westinghouse's fault. have to see how it holds up
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: So Far so good
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida, so I was looking for a reliable Generator for emergency, a power generator that can supply enough energy that I that I can stay at my house in case of a long power outrage. I Just finish my installation and did the first test. I am very happy with the performance. I was able to turn almost everything at my house including a fridge, TV, internet, Lights, 4T AC with no issues, and running on propane gas. I think over all is a very good product so far. The price was very acceptable and the delivery had no issues. I will send pictures latter.
customer_reviews.author: Hutch

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made Generator
customer_reviews.text: Have this set-up to attach to a power-inlet on my home for charging the breaker box. Assembly was easy with just a mounting of the wheels. Was delivered with out incident via freight truck. Not to heavy for one person to roll to the hookup location. Starts fast, runs strong, powers needed circuits. I am very pleased with this purchase and am ready for the hurricanes that I hope never come.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B

customer_reviews.title: Cant Store With Gasoline For Even A Short Time
customer_reviews.text: I bought to use as a backup for power outages. After sitting for three months and having fuel stabilizer in the tank, it now wont start. Westinghouse says that it must be stored without gasoline, even for two months. Nothing is mentioned about this in the user manual. This is a disappointment for use as a backup generator. If I had known I might have purchased a different type unit as a power backup
customer_reviews.author: San joseAndy

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up immediately. Runs like a top. Simple step by step directions for everything. Came delivered on its own pallet , that was a concern to me. (Read horror stories of having to send back items broken in shipment ) This came well boxed and no issues what so ever. I highly recommend this item, very well built and easy to run and understand all the features.
customer_reviews.author: Nick from Lakeville

customer_reviews.title: Great back up Gen
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a back up for the season. Got it all together in 15 mins, put the oil in and 1 gallon of gas. on the first try, it started with no problem. Got this Gen with the 50amp cord, tried it on my house which I wired with a manual switch and my main box is 200amp. Turned off my Hot water heater, range, Drier. Pretty much everything with a double pole breaker, except my AC unit. It ran everything in my house, ceiling fans in all the room, lights which I switched all of them out to LED, TV, home office, so I have to say I'm pretty pleased with this generator.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Chin

customer_reviews.title: Bent Frame Upon Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Dislike? Upon arrival the frame is bent. This can't be normal? The rear, left tire is touching the battery. Packing material was fine - so doesn't appear to be a shipping issue. This is a quality control at the factory issue. Hate to go through the hassle of returning this through Amazon. Not sure if this will effect overall performance. Started up just fine, but BENT!
customer_reviews.author: arock65

customer_reviews.title: It's a Westinghouse!
customer_reviews.text: This generator is perfect. We are thrilled that it has dual fuel capabilities, although upon further review we did learn that using gas will go longer than using propane. Still nice to have a backup option incase we run out of gas. When this arrived, my husband got it up and running easily and made sure it would do what he needed it to. Love the remote on and off. First storm came and of course we did not loose power (you know, since we now have the generator!) We do feel secure in saying that we feel this generator will work perfectly when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Built
customer_reviews.text: I just received this unit in 10 days of order. Arrived by common carrier and they put it in the garage. Easy to assemble with just putting on the wheels. Followed the manual and it started immediately and worked perfectly. Chose this model since it was made in the US. Also felt more comfortable with cast iron cylinder sleeves for durability. Had a Chinese unit prior and this unit is far superior. Good frame, large wheels and many extra items (tools, remote starter, battery, battery charger, etc.). Very impressed with the unit so far. Also promised a cover to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn  B.

customer_reviews.title: A user friendly generator
customer_reviews.text: For me, an interested but non-mechanically gifted, it’s an amazing product because it’s relatively simple to operate yet offers so many options, i.e., electric start, automatic choke, remote start, propane or gasoline powered, 2-30 amp outlets in addition to the main power supply, maneuverable yet big and powerful enough to run all our electrical service. We had an electrician do the wiring so with an outside weather proof connection it plugs into out electric 220 panel. It runs everything in our house. We have gas heat, hot water, abd a gas dryer so it powers everything with plenty to spare . It’s well made, very little plastic and fully serviceable from the welded housing to the engine. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: J. Tumberello

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT GENERATOR
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended as a standby / backup power source for those annoying power outages. Makes your home livable, keeps the refrigerator running as well as any sump pumps. Keeps some light on and lets you keep the kids entertained in a blackout with TV and cell phones etc. Worth the expense and this is an excellent well made generator with plenty of power. Make sure you buy some extra gas containers, the generator cover and appropriate sized power cords because you MUST operate the generator OUTDOORS at all times.
customer_reviews.author: TomB

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised/super simple to assemble
customer_reviews.text: We loved that this big generator was super simple to assemble. The pull up handle makes the 240 lbs. easy to move around. Once fuel was introduced it started on the first push of the auto start button. A bit noisier than we hoped for but our neighbor who has a home generator of equal size said it is typical of this size generator. No pulling of the cord! Yea! We couldn't be happier. We hope we never have to use it as an emergency generator but we'll sleep well knowing it is in the garage and can run almost everything in our home in a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J Muscardini

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Generator with all of the power you could need to run your home in a pinch.
customer_reviews.text: I put a transfer switch on the outside of our house for use in case we have a prolonged outage (Buffalo Winters Suck) -- After doing the math I figured I needed at max 5000 watts to run various lights, refrigerator, freezer and our steam boiler. This Generator will run them all without issue, and can also run a microwave and air fryer simultaneously. This was really surprising to me --- That and the fact that it is electric start made this a no brainer for me. For the money, this generator can not be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: versatile and excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this dual fuel to replace a similar sized generac, which we had continuous problems with. We have used this generator 70 hours at this point. I start with propane, and switch to gas when it was clear the power was gone for a while. It is a fantastic machine. Runs smoothly. Easily powers all systems in our 3200sq ft house without any bogging, flickering, etc. Have been using tons in the last week because of the hurricane/storm that bombed CT and just discovered that it runs the whole home AC. That's crazy.. So far an excellent machine, just great.
customer_reviews.author: Crockodillin

customer_reviews.title: absolutely great to have!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I keep loosing power at the house-storms, (tree's fallen down and power lines being taken out) This last storm no power 9 days. Well sure enough, worked like a dream!! Ran 2 refrigerators, boiler for hot water, air conditioning in two bedrooms and the stove. almost forgot the almighty coffee maker which is a must. Best buy will not regret. will recommend to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far bad batteries
customer_reviews.text: Got this product try to start it up would not start. Charge the battery, would not start. Charge the battery again. Would not start. Call the warranty department at Western House. They said they wouldn’t have batteries in stock until the first of the year. They will not accept your name on a want list. It’s first come first serve on the batteries . So I had to order a new battery which cost me $45. Now I’m waiting for the battery to come and I hope that’s all that’s wrong with it.bought a new battery and now it won’t run.sending it back. Please do yourself a favor,Don’t buy this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Price!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this generator, as portability, price and functionality. Big enough to use at my house when I need it! Took me few years to make a decision on a good generator, you can't go wrong with Westinghouse, made in USA. What else's can I say!
customer_reviews.author: S. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Westinhouse 5300 6600 watt Generator
customer_reviews.text: This item is great. The power is very steady with minimal surges and for the size of the unit it packs a good punch. Other generators that produce this much wattage are considerably larger in size taking up valuable space in your storage area. Seems a little better on fuel than the description states. It is RV ready and Transfer switch ready out of the box Big Plus for me. THD is also good. Steady voltage and amperage. I have used it up to about 80% total power with great results. Wheel Kit and Handel included make easy transport for one person. Can't say anything bad about this generator at this time. Recommended. Will update if issues arise.
customer_reviews.author: marco

customer_reviews.title: running on either gas or propane
customer_reviews.text: Super powerful generator with the options you want...running on either gas or propane. It's a solid machine but with the wheels and handle, it's plenty easy to maneuver. Great option for backup when the power goes out. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: srajr

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: Looking for an emergency generator and bought the WGen9500DF based on the great reviews. This is one solid, well built generator with great features, and I love the ability to use gas or propane. Easy starting and the smooth running. Have not used for a power outage yet, but did test it using various power tools and appliances. Works great.If you need a portable emergency generator, this is the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: The Westinghouse Wgen9500Dr was recommended buy a neighbor now that we have it we not only like the style but also the dependable that it has to give us electric when we need it and if necessary I have enough power on this unit even to help my neighbor if need be, so far so good. Plus the name Westinghouse has been around a long time. Right now we are using the gas mode for awhile then we want to try the propane mode and check out the different loads to check out which mode is more efficient when a crisis arises
customer_reviews.author: Harold Espy

customer_reviews.title: Minor damage
customer_reviews.text: The generator seems to work good, however the frame was a bit bent the gasoline gage does not work and the spark plug was broke. Contacted the shipping number on the package and sent pictures but they said to contact the company. I was on hold and could not get through. A little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: More than powerful
customer_reviews.text: Besides a minor ding in one of the top cross-members, based on the condition of the box it was done in shipping, this generator will be more than powerful enough to keep our food from spoiling during the next major power outage. The push button start works amazingly as well as the remote. Looking forward to the next power outage to but this generator to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Shipping issue - not sellers fault
customer_reviews.text: Have no problem with the seller nor the product! Generator is great and they shipped on schedule. My issue was with the carrier that received the product and then delivered it. It arrived to their facility on 9/17 but they did not contact me until 9/24 (1 full week) to arrange for delivery on 9/25. On 9/25 at 3PM they called to say their truck broke down (30 minutes from my house) and would call me on Monday 9/28 to reschedule. We called them 9/28 and they said "one day this week". We finally got our generator delivered on Wednesday after it being with the carrier for almost 2 full weeks!
customer_reviews.author: C. Caples

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design. Everything within reach. Has great foldable handle to move around. Fits nicely in garage corner. Electric Start excellent. Great fuel capacity for its size. love the 110/240 options. For the price this is an excellent value. Noise level is about average. I find that noise level also depends on you placement. Sure there are quieter ones but I bought it for power not for sound level. Cost a lot less than the steaks and cuisine in my freezer if there is an extended power outage.
customer_reviews.author: wild thing

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product - it is exactly as listed. We had an issue with delivery, they came three days early (someone has to be available to sign and they are suppose to deliver within the threshold) and it was a good thing we were home since they wouldn’t drive down our driveway — they just decided to deliver it early. The box was trashed and the delivery person didn’t seem to care - told us to call the manufacturer if we had an issue. I’m happy to report, no issues with the generator!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Geer

customer_reviews.title: The best features for the price! Frame was bent in shipping
customer_reviews.text: The best features for the price. The remote start is a really nice feature, also is "smart switch ready" which will auto start and transfer house to generator when power is lost. Shipping is another story though. As you can see in the picture, the frame is not square, and the bottom frame is bent. Will it effect the operation, or weaken over time? Only time will tell. However, I didn't pay a bent up price for it, paid for new, but received damaged item
customer_reviews.author: Relentless

customer_reviews.title: 4 prong 50 amp outlet
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my Lifan 8100E generator which was 7K amps continuous. It only had a 30 amp outlet. This one has a 50 amp and a 30 amp outlet. The issue is finding a cable to use it. I found it best to make my own that connects to the breaker box. This generator powers a heat pump, TV, computer, battery chargers, water pump, lights except for the hot water heater in my barn/shop.
customer_reviews.author: R. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: 1st time I ordered this item it came in a cardboard box basically looked like they dropped it out of a plane it was so dented up. Two or three weeks later they came and delivered a new one and took the old dented one. New ones box looked a little beat up not as bad opened box this time only one major dent and stuck a sticker over it, but looking closer at the frame looks like it was re painted over damaged spots with touch up paint have a feeling a lot of these were damaged some how and refurbished? I guess you get what you pay for should have bought a Honda oh well.
customer_reviews.author: tony banchio

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I live outside Columbus, Ohio. My 13 year old 7500 watt Honeywell took a crap, so after doing lots of research, I chose this 7500 watt model. Took delivery this morning. Easy to assemble, and I would estimate it's about 30% quieter than my old Honeywell. LOVE the remote start and auto-choke features. Hooked it up to my transfer switch, runs flawlessly, and I can run my entire 3200 sq ft home with tons of power to spare (except the heat pump, of course), but my 30,000 BTU ventless propane fireplace takes care of the heat. Looking forward to the next outage! Lol
customer_reviews.author: MattyOH

product_meta.title: Westinghouse WGen7500 Portable Generator with Remote Electric Start - 7500 Rated Watts & 9500 Peak Watts - Gas Powered - CARB Compliant - Transfer Switch Ready
product_meta.description: Style:WGen7500The Westinghouse WGen7500 Portable Generator is a powerful and easy-to-use power source to keep your home prepared for emergency events. It produces 9,500 peak watts and 7,500 running watts, operating for up to 11 hours on 6.6 Gal. (25 L) gasoline fuel tank. The WGen7500 features Push-Button Electric Start, conveniently pairing with a wireless remote key fob for effortless ignition. Forged with a cast iron sleeve, the WGen7500 has a 420cc 4-Stroke OHV Westinghouse Engine constructed for durability. It's equipped with a built-in fuel gauge, automatic low oil shutdown, and GFCI household outlets for added protection. The L14-30R outlet is Transfer Switch Ready, connecting straight to your home for total household power and eliminating the hassle for annoying extension cords or power strips. The WGen7500 is easy to care for with a VFT Data Center to share real-time updates on maintenance information, ensuring long life and lasting utility. A hardened-steel frame with added roll bars, foam grip handle, and never-flat wheels lets you easily transport this generator on the go while rubber outlet covers provide added protection from the environment. The WGen7500 is complete with a 3-Year limited service, labor, and parts coverage with Lifetime Technical Support backed by our nationwide customer service and support network.
feature_bullets: Features Two GFCI (Ground Fault Circuit Interrupter) 5-20R 120V Household Duplex Receptacle and One L14-30R 120/240V Twist-Lock Receptacle; All Outlets Have Rubber Covers for Added Safety
Plug-and-Play: Comes with a Remote Start Key Fob, 12V Battery Charger, Oil, an Oil Funnel, a Tool Kit, and a User's Manual to Get You Started Right Out of the Box (Minimal Assembly Required)
Powered by a 420cc Westinghouse 4-Stroke OHV Engine Featuring a Long-Lasting Cast Iron Sleeve with Automatic Low Oil Shutdown and Digital Hour Meter. Noise Level-72 dBA

All Westinghouse Portable Generators are Functionally Tested in the Factory and May Contain Minimum Residual Oil and/or Fuel Odor; EPA and CARB Compliant; Backed by 3-Year Limited Service, Labor, and Parts Coverage with Nationwide Customer Service Network
7500 Running Watts and 9500 Peak Watts; Remote Start With Included Key Fob, Electric and Recoil Start; Up to 11 Hours of Run Time on a 6.6 Gallon Fuel Tank With Fuel Gauge

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,960 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
